text:
Felix Gary Gray (born July 17, 1969) is an American movie director, producer, music video director and actor. Gray's first directed movie was the comedy "Friday" (1995). He then went on to direct movies such as "Set It Off" (1996), "The Negotiator" (1998), "The Italian Job" (2003), "Be Cool" (2005), "Law Abiding Citizen" (2009), "Straight Outta Compton" (2015) and ' (2019). He also directed the eighth movie in the "Fast & Furious" franchise, "The Fate of the Furious" (2017). As of 2020, it is the 18th highest-grossing movie of all time.
Gray started his career directing music videos. Notable music videos directed by Gray include "It Was a Good Day" by Ice Cube, "Natural Born Killaz" by Dr. Dre and Ice Cube, "Keep Their Heads Ringin'" by Dr. Dre, "Waterfalls" by TLC and "Ms. Jackson" by Outkast.
Gray was born in New York City. He grew up mostly in South Los Angeles, California.
